comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
The first woman on the left looks like Elisabeth Freeman.  Freeman is at the center of this photo, which features the same stenciled shoulder bags:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3314493806/]

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: The woman next to Elisabeth Freeman seems to be Vera Wentworth, an English suffragette.

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Freeman and Wentworth are also depicted in this photo. They aren't identified in its caption but are wearing the same outfits as in the photo above. They and others in the 1913 suffrage caravan are identified on Shorpy's web page here.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: pennylrichardsca and whyaduck: Thanks to you both for providing information about the identities of two of the women in this photograph. I've also identified the other two, so from left to right, we have: Elisabeth Freeman, Vera Wentworth, Elsie McKenzie and Ida Craft. Craft is depicted in a number of our suffrage-related images, including these two examples: one and two. We'll expand the caption for this record when we update.
